paragraph.paragraph:
The Class View allows you to browse the Eiffel classes that are included in your solution. You may only browse the classes of a compiled system that is currently open in Visual Studio. As well as being able to view available classes, the Class View allows you to see the
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlfeature features of each class and the relationships between classes, for example,
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlancestors ancestors or
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmldescendants descendants .

Looking at the screenshot, you can see that there is one root node in the Class View, which corresponds to the fact that there is only one project, named "sample", in the currently opened solution. If there is more than one project in the current solution, then there will be multiple entries in the tree.

Each node in the tree is expandable, and expanding a node will allow you to see the pertinent information regarding the current node that was opened. For example, in the screenshot above, the cluster "root_cluster" is expanded, and this allows the Class View to display all Eiffel classes within that cluster (Only one in this case). In the case of an expanded tree node representing an Eiffel class, you can see that information specific to classes has been displayed, and is browsable.
You may browse as deeply within the Class View as is necessary, as there is no limit to the depth of the nodes that may be opened.

Right clicking on any node in the Class View will display a
context_menu.xml context menu for the current node.

For details of the hierarchy displayed in the Class View, click
hierarchy.xml here .
